entry.dialog: Hello! Oh you're new here? You know Jay Gatsby? / I live on the other side of the water… in the East Egg. / If you're not too busy can you help me find my friend Jordan?
Mr. Gatsby wants to see me? Oh I'll go see him right now! / Do you mind going to Mr. Gatsby's library and finding a good book for me? I've been wanting to read something new.

Hello! Good to meet you. Oh you know Mr. Gatsby? / He's so handsome! / Oh Daisy wants to talk to me? Well, I'm sort of preoccupied at the moment… / I'll tell you what, I lost my purse somewhere… if you find it for me, I'll go talk to Daisy.
Thank you for finding my purse! Now to go see why Daisy wanted to talk to me… / You should go find Nick Carraway, he might be able to tell you more about Mr. Gatsby than I.

Why hello! Oh you're new here? I'm new as well, I just moved in next door… What's your occupation? / Oh you're in publishing! Mr. Gatsby has an impressive collection of books, you should go talk to him about it. He should be out by the docks...

Why hello Old Sport! I haven't seen you around here before… I hope you're enjoying my party. / Oh Nick sent you my way to talk about books? Well… umm … / You should eventually check out my library, old sport, it's filled with them. / Oh so you've met Daisy? She's a great friend of mine, you can see her home across the bay… / She has a green light that burns all night at the end of her dock…. / Can you find Daisy and tell her to come find me? Thanks old sport.

Wow, look at all these books! What an amazing display! / Look at this one, it's a bona-fide piece of printed matter. It fooled me. This fella's a regular Belasco. It's a triumph. What thoroughness! What realism! Knew when to stop, too - didn't cut the pages. But what do you want? What do you expect? / Oh you're looking for a book? That one over there, it looks like a good book.
You've found The Great Gatsby book! We can now digitize it for the kindle!
